entry.title: New release for tinyfeed: v1.1.0
entry.content:
Added:

  • Support for comments in inputs file by prepending # ( by @ebrahimHakimuddin )
  • New option --per-feed-limit to set the maximum number of article to display per feed
  • New recipe to deploy tinyfeed using github-actions and github-page
  • Add "Last Updated on {Date}" at the bottom of the page (by @ebrahimHakimuddin )
  • Automatically remove duplicates feeds

Fixed:

  • Spelling mistake in warning: 'domaine' --> 'domain' @ebrahimHakimuddin

Miscellaneous:

  • Add tests to avoid regression

entry.title: New release for tinyfeed: v1.3.0
entry.content:
This release focuses on delivering comprehensive documentation, expanding customization options, and tightening security practices.

ğŸ“š Documentation

  • A full documentation website is now live! It includes clear guides on getting started, customizing your feed, integrating tinyfeed with various workflows (GitHub Pages, cron, Docker, systemd, OpenRC), and live demos to showcase TinyFeedâ€™s capabilities.
  • Command-line flags in --help are now grouped by category for easier discovery.

âœ¨ Features

  • New --script (shorthand -S) flag to inject JavaScript files into the generated page.
  • Both --stylesheet and --script can now be repeated to include multiple assets.
  • Binary size reduced by 45% (6.5MB) thanks to UPX compression.
  • The "updated at" timestamp on the generated page is now localized via JavaScript, with a fallback for browsers without JS.

ğŸ”’ Security

  • Content Security Policy has been further tightened.
  • GitHub Actions now run with permissions: none by default.
